meanings.definition: Green with grass or other rich vegetation.
meanings.sent1: The verdant meadow was filled with lush green grass.
meanings.sent2: The hills were verdant with fresh vegetation after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The verdant lawn seemed to sparkle in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes widened at the sight of the verdant forest before her.
meanings.sent5: The verdant landscape was a soothing sight for tired eyes.

meanings.sent1: The young intern was quite verdant in the ways of the office.
meanings.sent2: She felt a bit verdant when it came to navigating the city on her own.
meanings.sent3: His verdant attempts at cooking often resulted in comical disasters.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a verdant seedling in the vast garden of corporate life.
meanings.sent5: The team welcomed the verdant recruit with open arms and patient guidance.
